{"title": "Kim's Game", "title_search": "kims game", "title_keyword": "kims game", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/kims-game/", "summary": "This memory puzzle game is based on one made famous by Rudyard Kipling's novel "Kim".  But even if you're not trying to foil the imperial ambitions of Czarist Russia in Afghanistan, strong powers of memory, concentration, and pattern recognition are worth developing. Playing this game will challenge and improve all of these.  Each game begins by presenting you with a random collection of zodiac signs. After 10 seconds, the signs are covered, and you have to touch where each one is located when its prompt appears.  The game has 5 levels. The lowest level displays 3 zodiac signs, and the highest displays all 12. To move to the next level, you have to uncover each sign without making any mistakes.  For each level, the game keeps track of how many attempts you have made, and the fewest number of mistakes so far.  Don't get discouraged! Your scores in this game will improve with practice. Still, you are unlikely to complete the highest level, no matter how long you try. {"title": "Sudoku 101", "title_search": "sudoku 101", "title_keyword": "sudoku 101", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/sudoku-101/", "summary": "Wondering what the hype is about Sudoku?  This is the introductory course for Sudoku, ideal for beginners. It is a Sudoku game, a generator, a solver, and a teacher/tutor.  First, it is a real Sudoku game.  - Puzzle generator for unlimited play, at the difficulty level appropriate for beginners. - Clean and simple game board, so you can focus on the playing instead of being distracted by colors and/or graphics. - Ability to enter the game manually, copy from books, newspaper, or other Sudoku game software. - Tap on a clue to highlight potential locations, tap again to go back to normal viewing. - Automatic or manual pencil marks, which can be switched on and off during the play with one tap. - Automatically save the game when you leave, continue when you come back. - Option to use either symmetrical or non-symmetrical Sudoku boards. - Option to show error.  Even more, it is your private tutorial. It teaches you the logic and pattern of Sudoku, with its multi-step teaching system. All of the techniques are human logic, not computer brutal force.  - When you are stuck, tap "Teach me". It highlights certain cells of interest. - Tap again, it will tell you the technique to look for in those cells. A "What is..." buttons also shows up. You can look up the meaning of this technique. - Tap again, it will show you the logic. Which candidate is of interest, why, and how it helps you to solve a cell, or to remove digits from possible candidates. - Tap again, it updates the board, ready for the next step.  During the course of Sudoku 101, you will go through the following levels: - Learning Basics: This level is for the absolute beginner. It uses Sudoku boards which be solved by the Full House. - Easy: At this level, the puzzles can be solved with Full House, Naked Single, Hidden Single, and occasional pairs. - Moderate: You will learn Naked Pair, Hidden Pair, and Locked Candidates.  Check out the screenshots to see how the teaching works.  Not enough for you? Ready for more challenge? {"title": "iDrive - Le Simulateur de Conduite", "title_search": "idrive  le simulateur de conduite", "title_keyword": "idrive  le simulateur de conduite", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/idrive-le-simulateur-de-conduite/", "summary": "iDrive – Le simulateur de conduite est un jeu de conduite automobile en vue aérienne dans une ville entière, avec ses rues, ses carrefours, sa signalisation…   Participez à de nombreuses missions et récoltez un maximum de points pour accéder à la suivante.  Il vous faudra éviter les infractions au Code de la Route pour ne pas de perdre tous les points de votre permis et recommencer la partie.  Trois modes de jeu :  - Parcours : conduisez votre voiture et arrivez à destination en respectant la signalisation routière (feu, Stop, limitations de vitesses, sens interdit…).  - Trace chronométré : franchissez les checkpoint le plus rapidement possible, sans vous soucier du Code de la Route, sur un circuit balisé.  Créneau : Entraîner-vous à maîtriser les créneaux, en vous garant dans des emplacements réduits.  Une jouabilité spécifique à l’iPhone :  - Orientez l’iPhone comme un volant pour tourner.  - Utilisez l'accelerateur et le frein pour contrôler la vitesse du véhicule. - Déplacez votre doigt sur la jauge d’accélération pour doser votre vitesse au kilomètre-heure près.  ♦ Une surface de jeu très importante dans une ville entière. ♦ Une jouabilité novatrice avec prise en compte du Code de la Route et une conduite accessible. ♦ Un défi de tous les instants : pour ne pas perdre de points de permis, il faudra faire attention à tous les éléments de la route (limitations de vitesse, feux, sens interdit…).", "genre": ["Simulation"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2009-07-31", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-126017-17.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-126017-17.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America"], "companies": ["Anuman Interactive (Publisher)", "Anuman Interactive (Developer)"], "platforms": ["iOS (iPhone/iPad)"], "rating": null}

{"title": "Coach Blackjack", "title_search": "coach blackjack", "title_keyword": "coach blackjack", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/coach-blackjack/", "summary": "Learn to play perfect strategy in Blackjack!  BlackJack 101 is a basic strategy trainer for the game of Blackjack. This is *not* a Blackjack game. It deals hands and lets you practice choosing the best strategy. It has an easy-to-use strategy guide that shows the correct move for every combination of hands.   Blackjack 101 allows you to adjust the playing rules to match conditions commonly found in casinos, including the number of decks in the shoe, the dealer's action on a soft 17, doubling rules, and surrender. It also allows you to focus your training on the trickier hands: pairs and soft hands. Plus it has both a left- and right-handed layout, to make it easy to play with one hand or two.   Features:  - Three learning modes: random hands, pairs, and soft hands  - Strategy guide shows all the best moves  - Left-handed and right-handed playing layouts  - Many different rule configurations (1-4 decks, dealer hits/stays on soft 17, double after split, early/late surrender)  - Keeps track of your stats: hands played, choices made, and percent of correct guesses  Look for a free version soon: BlackJack 101 Free", "genre": ["Gambling"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2009-09-01", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-130560-52.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-130560-52.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America"], "companies": ["Dave Richmond (Publisher)", "Dave Richmond (Developer)"], "platforms": ["iOS (iPhone/iPad)"], "rating": null}

{"title": "iChapaev", "title_search": "ichapaev", "title_keyword": "ichapaev", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/ichapaev/", "summary": "*** Featured as New and Noteworthy in iTunes *** #1 in Russian Top Paid Apps  The year is 1923.  You are Vasily Chapayev, leader of the Russian Red Army and hero to the people.  Since the beginning of your country’s Civil War in 1917, you’ve lead your soldiers to victory many times.  Many times, you fought and won but not today.  Right now, you are wounded and fleeing capture from your enemies.  They’re closing in fast, you’re surrounded and there’s no place to go but the river.  Determined to make it to freedom, you dive in, swimming for your very life.  As you get close to the other side, you can see the shore and freedom.  Just a few more feet to go and you will have made your escape.  Just a few more feet, a few more minutes, that’s all that’s standing between you and life because not getting there is certain death.  As you climb out of the water to head for the trees, an enemy bullet finds you.  You take in the forest that would have saved your life as you fall to the ground.  The life drains from your body mere inches away from cover. This story of Vasily Chapayev is true.  He was a legendary hero of the Russian Civil War (1917 – 1923).  A valiant horseman and talented military leader, Chapayev won many victories until enemy White Army soldiers wounded and captured him.  Chapayev was shot while trying to swim across a river to freedom.  He almost made it before the bullet ended his life. The legend of Chapayev lives on in the iCapaev app.  Chapayev is the most popular board game in The Soviet Union.  Dynamic and exciting, it’s like a dashing cavalry attack and gambling game.  Rules of the game are diabolically simple.  Shoot enemy checkers from the board while ensuring that as many of yours stay on as possible.  If yours is the last man standing, you win.  You’ll need a keen eye and strong hand to be the victor in this app but more than that, you need clever strategy. Each iChapaev player gets 8 checkers to start, which are placed on opposite ends of the game board.  Go ahead and use your finger to pull back your checker, then let go to shoot toward your opponent’s game piece.  Little arrows indicate the direction and stroke power of your shot.  The player with at least one checker left on the board wins the battle.  The war is not over with the first battle, though.  A second battle starts with the first game’s loser playing with one less checker.  Does that ensure that you’ll win this round?  No.  If your opponent has found an excellent strategy, you may find it challenging to overthrow him in the second game.  All is fair in love and war and that includes iChapaev.  You never know who is going to win. If you want to give yourself a game playing advantage, fine tune your skills and hone your moves by playing against the app initially.  After you’ve developed your game playing skills, invite a partner to join you in a war game.  If you’ve practiced and perfected your game, you’re bound to win more than you lose.  Just to keep things interesting, there are three levels of complexity: * Easy level — the arrow showing the direction and the force of strike has depicted * Medium level — just the arrow showing the direction of strike has depicted * High level — the arrow hasn’t been depicted at all  So, who will you be, The White Army with at least one checker left on the board, or the poor hero Chapayev?  There’s only one way to find out.
